sandra.examples.tts.ttswithlib
Class TTSWithLib

java.lang.Object
  android.content.Context
      android.content.ContextWrapper
          android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
              android.app.Activity
                  sandra.examples.tts.ttswithlib.TTSWithLib
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback
public class TTSWithLib
extends android.app.Activity

TTSDemo: Basic app with text to speech synthesis using the TTSLib Simple demo in which the user writes a text in a text field and it is synthesized by the system when pressing a button.

Version:
2.6, 11/24/13
Author:
Zoraida Callejas, Michael McTear
See Also:
TTSBegin for the equivalent app without the TTSLib library (note: TTSBegin does not allow to set the language).

Overrides:
onCreate in class android.app.Activity

setLocalesConsidered

private void setLocalesConsidered()
Builds an ArrayList with the names of the locales considered. The first one is the device's default locale, and it also includes EN and ES. This way, the user will be able to choose between a maximum of 3 languages: the default, English and Spanish, and a minimum of 2 if the default locale is Spanish or English. These options are presented in the GUI through a ListView comprised of a single-option radio button group in which the device's locale is checked by default

Sets up the locale selection list and a listener for the locale choice
